description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。

**English II (for Non-English Majors)**

**Spring 2022**

**I.** 教學目標**Objectives:**

This course aims to help students to develop and improve their English abilities; meanwhile, it also helps to build up students’ confidence and interests in English. Student’s participation, discussion, and group activities in class will be the main focus of this course. Different activities will be offered to guide the students to apply basic English vocabularies, sentences, and grammar to build the familiarity toward English, including using different kinds of visual aids, games, and news...etc. Students will engage in different discussion and practice under the instructor’s guide to improve students’ English speaking, listening, writing, and reading abilities. In addition to understanding the grammar and vocabulary, students are required to have further critical thinking toward the issues, subjects, and contents given in class.

**II.** 課本**Textbook:**

Macintyre, Paul & Bohlke, David. (2019). **_Reading Explorer: Book 2 (Third Edition)_**_._ National Geographic Learning.

**\*Please get the book at** 師大書苑或自行到海學文化出版社**.**

**III.** **School Activities & Competitions**

1\. Three-Minute PPT Presentation Competition: You will choose a topic and present your ideas for 3 minutes based on several specific SDGs

(United Nations Sustainable Development Goals) by using PowerPoint. Date: 5/20 (Friday)

2\. Cultural Exchange: International students will join classes and introduce their diverse cultures to local students. Date: End of April

3\. TOEIC Exam: Instead of taking the Lexile exam, you will take the TOEIC exam (Listening & Reading). Registration: 2/14- 2/25, Test Date:3/26 (Saturday).

IV. **Course Requirements and Grading Policy**

1.  **Reading Assignments:** You are expected to complete readings before coming to class.
2.  **Attendance and Participation (20%):** Attendance and participation in class are required. Be punctual for class and send a notice to the instructor when you cannot attend a class meeting. More than three unexcused absences will result in an F in your final grade. Discussing these texts with the instructor and your peers will enhance your understanding of the texts.
3.  **Oral Presentation (20%):** You will be expected to give a 3-minute presentation.
4.  **Midterm Exam (20%):** Questions are based on knowledge provided in class.
5.  **Final Exam (20%):** Questions are based on knowledge provided in class.
